title: England's response to New Zealand haka set tone for dethroning 'Gods of Rugby' but Eddie Jones wants to finish the job
text:
Eddie Jones hailed his team’s display as they demolished and dethroned “the gods of rugby” in a near-perfect 19-7 victory to win through to their first World Cup final in 12 years.

England’s stunning performance against All Blacks, who were back-to-back defending world champions, means they will play either Wales or South Africa, who meet on Sunday morning in the second semi-final. It also took them to No 1 in the world rankings.

England’s win was only their second in the past 17 encounters between the sides. It was the first in four attempts at a World Cup.

Celebrations were muted...
description: Eddie Jones hailed his team’s display as they demolished and dethroned “the gods of rugby” in a near-perfect 19-7 victory to win through to their first World Cup final in 12 years.
